message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MA, cs.SY, cs.DC

This paper deals with the problem of interference among Wireless Body Area Networks (WBANs) and proposes a distributed approach for minimizing the impact of co-channel interference through dynamic channel hopping based on Latin rectangles. The paper focuses on the medium access arbitration among interfering WBANs, which is a key issue in the field of networked systems and communication. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). 

The paper also involves the use of mathematical models and optimization techniques for channel allocation and medium access scheduling, which are typical topics in the sub-categories of cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems). 

Moreover, the paper proposes a distributed approach that adapts to the size of the network and to the density of sensors forming each individual WBAN, which is related to the sub-category of cs.SY (Systems and Control). 

Finally, the paper addresses the issue of reducing the overhead resulting from channel hopping, which is a common concern in the sub-category of cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing).
